documents.document: @ScottAdamsSays Perhaps you should stop talking acid then, Scott.
@benpobjie Same with swimming in the ocean.
@DavidLeyonhjelm It didn't take hindsight. It was obvious the deal was dead from the instant the election result was known.
@benpobjie To be fair, those are from United States figures. 500 deaths/year, compared to about 1/year for sharks. Oz stats probs higher.
@benpobjie You are 500 times more likely to die from autoerotic asphyxiation than from a shark attack.
@abcnews @realDonaldTrump It's not that they're fearful. DT does such a good job of satirizing himself, the just aren't any jokes left.
@carol20120 @NatGeo No, haven't read it yet, but I know they often pair up. Even so, the tweet says 'watch the sun... in the night sky'.
@washingtonpost Probably the worst phone call Turnbull had that day as well. Trump hates it when you don't suck hard enough.
@NatGeo Umm, wouldn't that be a SOLAR eclipse? During lunar eclipse, sun is on other side of the earth, so you can't watch it do anything.
@MikeCarlton01 Ahh, the sweet sweet balm of nostalgia.
@Jess4_RK Some enterprising con-man has realised Trump supporters are easy targets. Just dial 1800-suckers!
@ScottAdamsSays This is one of the more stupid posts I've seen you make, @ScottAdamsSays. But to be honest, you haven't set a high bar.
@AstroKatie About 7pm AEST? If so, I think I saw the same one. 😊
@nicholaslue @chrislhayes @POTUS An informal logical fallacy called "moving the goalposts". I've seen a lot of that going on today.

@sarahinthesen8 It's probably from one of your highly educated senate colleagues. You should wander around parliame… https://t.co/wvP1q9stwI
@bencjenkins @RichardDawkins - "Follow the holy gord of Jerusalem!" - "No! It is the Shoe! Take the shoe and follow him!"
@fakeedbutler Is this real? Is he trying to put comedians out of work by satirizing himself? Truly astonishing.
@Coconutdog01 @quick_crazy @problogger @DavidLeyonhjelm It's spelled 'hyperbole', and I don't think you are using t… https://t.co/OJgJXlQEL0
@CaraSantaMaria @washingtonpost I heard she was wrong about literally everything. 😁
@stevevsninjas @benpobjie 5. Too loud and irritating 4. Used to be cool, a bit dead now 3. Good for old folks 2. Wh… https://t.co/uN6BpnZQc2
@JenniferRaff @realscientists @AdamRutherford Was it Jesus? It was Jesus, wasn't it. Please tell me you're going to clone Jesus.
@Coconutdog01 @quick_crazy @problogger @DavidLeyonhjelm It certainly says a lot about the person who uses it.
@DavidLeyonhjelm I'm a taxpayer, so I'm partially paying your salary. I want my fucking money back.
@ReutersScience @Reuters He should talk with his party about that. He might find the Republican dominated Congress… https://t.co/hyr3Kq58Lz
@DavidLeyonhjelm @braddybb @BuzzFeedNews Hahahahaha! "Whiny". That's pretty rich...
@DavidLeyonhjelm, the biggest sook in Parliament, has the gall to complain that others are thin skinned. Pathetic little man. @ToryShepherd
@MikeCarlton01 STOP THE BOATS!!
@goldengateblond @clairebbbear If you do badly on the quiz, just try it again. Soon you will be better informed. Merry Christmas. 😈
@goldengateblond @clairebbbear Everyone should test their knowledge of Jesus's life with this quiz. https://t.co/X37rcpBv6T
@ScottAdamsSays Only pursuasive to those with 'innate biases'. Bad article with no understanding of climate science or psychology.
@CaraSantaMaria The 'Citizen Kane' of action movies.
@sciencequiche Thanks Kishore, I'll read more. But not nec. inconsistent with there being a few powerful voices who deliberately mislead.
Could you elaborate on this @sciencequiche? What research is there on climate change discourse? Would like to read some. @BadAstronomer
@woolongs @animaldrumss This one is the winner!
@ClickHole @TheOnion Wow. I've never been so moved (spirituality speaking) from a piece of music before. Bravo!
@juliagalef @aeonmag Good article though. Thanks for posting.
@juliagalef @aeonmag Just because it's not effective for avoiding recrimination, doesn't mean it's not a post hoc strategy.
@juliagalef @aeonmag Post hoc moral rationalisation of a violent act could be motivated by desire for psychological coherence.
@timminchin @YouTube It certainly ages well.
@abcnews Dr Parkinson says PS 'fails to embrace risk'. Perhaps the headline of this article shows why they might be risk averse.
@smh He's only got a limited time, so we'd better put him in jail quickly to maximise the amount of justice we can achieve.
@TIME Dont forget Adolf Hitler was TIME MOTY in1938. It's about who is most influencial, not about who is a good guy.
@CharlesMBlow @nytimes That is one very elegant dressing down. Beautifully written, and right on the money in my opinion.
@mrtonymartin I think these two ladies are overqualified for @realDonaldTrump 's cabinet. Probably far too kind and decent, as well.
Good on you @sarahinthesen8. If we don't call out this emboldened racism, it becomes legitimised. And that's a dangerous road to go down...
@parker_shona @JaneCaro Trump is literally the opposite of honest. He's the world's most successful con man. (he is sexist though)
@QandA @SenatorAbetz @mrbenjaminlaw If we were the 51st state, we would've got to vote. Maybe the outcome would have been different.
@realDonaldTrump How can the the two next leaders of the world be such massive sooks? America has free speech. Suck it up and grow a pair.
@MikeyRobins Some of us still prefer the old terminology.
@smh The jellyfish theory seems pretty plausible.
@DrCraigEmerson @vanOnselenP I keep seeing Trump supporters insist they haven't made a stupid decision. Methinks they protest too much...
@riversstreetx @bugspol @ToninaKelly @pushingabiggear Something you might Google is 'confirmation bias'. Also, 'appeal to authority'. Try it
@riversstreetx @bugspol @ToninaKelly @pushingabiggear @srosenholtz Please go to school and learn what actual research is. Hint, not Google.
@riversstreetx @bugspol @ToninaKelly @pushingabiggear @srosenholtz @Medium On what basis would you resort to insults. Run out of arguments?
@riversstreetx @bugspol @ToninaKelly @pushingabiggear @srosenholtz @Medium No. I think he was a poor president, and made some bad decisions.
@riversstreetx @bugspol @ToninaKelly @pushingabiggear @srosenholtz @Medium Most investigated candidate in history. If no charges by now...
@riversstreetx @bugspol @ToninaKelly @pushingabiggear @srosenholtz @Medium Bring on faith based convictions. No evidence, we just KNOW...
@riversstreetx @ToninaKelly @pushingabiggear @srosenholtz That's not a way to find evidence. That's a way to indulge in confirmation bias.
@riversstreetx @ToninaKelly @pushingabiggear @srosenholtz So you don't have any evidence. Thought so. BTW, conspiracy websites don't count.
@riversstreetx @ToninaKelly @pushingabiggear @srosenholtz What actual evidence you have? Cos I've waited ages to see some, and... Nothing.
@ivovic @neiltyson OK, I thought you might be a trouble soul, but now I see you are just a halfwit dickhead. No wonder you support Trump.
@ivovic @neiltyson I just noticed how much energy and anger you were projecting in your tweets, and I was worried about your mental health.
@ivovic @neiltyson You don't know anything about me, but yet you have so much anger toward me. Blind rage never leads to sound judgements.
@ivovic @neiltyson For a person who is on the winning side of the result, you sound incredibly insecure. Perhaps you need counselling.
@LaTrioli @mjrowland68 The punishment for being dishonest - you can no longer trust anyone else.
@michaelkoziol Clearly it's Kool Aid.
@albericie @BrettMasonNews @guardianworld I assume they called in Samuel L Jackson.
@GuardianAus @guardian I thought they'd stopped the boats. If the boats aren't coming, what's the point of more disincentives?
@smh @PoliticsFairfax The idea that they have souls to sell is pretty amusing.
@DrCraigEmerson The Sentinel by the Hilltop Hoods.
@inthehansard Pretty sure it's the Borg in Star Trek. "Prepare to assimilate. Resistance is futile." Not enough Sci-fi geeks in parliament.
@ABCthedrum @chrisberg I'd be going the other way, myself. One = professional specialist in relevnt field, other = professional liar.
@smh Science teaches humility, things always more complex than they appear. Politics invites arrogant faith in simplistic solutions.
@barriecassidy @janecat60 @MailOnline Even putting aside the general meanness, it shows a breathtaking lack of political judgement.
@BevanShields @smh I think the article was a bit unfair to Philistines, who were a actually a very cultured and cosmopolitan civilization.
@theage @presto So now do I have to choose between my love of FTWD and my loathing of the Murdoch empire?
@abcnews Time will tell whether the govt improves it or not, but #gonski supporters should take time to understand how current model works.
@abcnews This is good news! Current funding model is not what #gonski recommended. It's deeply unfair, benefits elite private schools.
@SenatorMRoberts @theprojecttv You have the worst case of Dunning-Kruger effect I've ever seen. Hint: there's a website called "Google"
@realscientists Life on other planets?
@realDonaldTrump @tonyschwartz I like how you sign off your tweets with your nickname, but the exclamation point is probably not necessary.
@abcnews That day my Mamma socked it to the Harper Valley PTA.
@michaelshermer @LeeStrobel Some people r more peaceful thn others. I think religion not a particularly reliable predictor.
@canberratimes And then he had the gall to suggest that he was only influenced by data and evidence. He is a ridiculous man with no insight.
@canberratimes The man claimed, with no evidence, that the entire scientific world was engaged in a massive conspiracy to fake climate data.
@JaneCaro He didn't provide much empirical evidence of the apparent global conspiracy of science organisations to fake climate data.
@sarahinthesen8 @guardian I think you're being a little unfair - There's no reason why they couldn't be both.
@Birmo Mybe shld have equivalent of bar exam for lawyers. Can't teach until you show basic proficiency. May improve status of profession.
@500px @Squiver What is a mirror doing out here on the savanna?
@safimichael @firstdogonmoon @ginarush Maybe the media will just stop listening to her (They'll be more focused on the flying pigs).
@adambspencer It's a big red button. How could anyone resist?
@Zhanadoodle Sigh...
@Zhanadoodle Consider the chump waxed...
@Zhanadoodle Yeah, I'm pretty replaceable. You could substitute any number of hot celebrities and no one would notice the difference.
@canberratimes I find the the use of the term 'reasonable adult' in this ruling to be pretty offensive to my sense of basic English.
@500px @kimleuen If it's real (with tilt shift), then it looks like it's stuck in the mud, with the tide coming in.
@ABCthedrum @chrisberg Faith based policy.
@TheKouk @ABCFactCheck @FactCheckJohn They are just trying to correct for the well known left wing bias of reality.
@theage Note to journalists: the 'car crash' or 'train wreck' interview metaphor has officially been overused. Stop doing it!
